channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Why do Americans still think 1969 Moon landing was fake? Kim Kardashian is newest conspiracy theorist
Does JD Vance want his Hindu wife Usha to convert? The row over his remark and his journey with Christianity
Did Kash Patel use $60 million FBI jet to watch his girlfriend sing at an event?
Is Pakistan training Islamic State fighters? What are the regional implications?
By the numbers: What’s behind the gummy takeover this Halloween?
Will India help Afghanistan build a dam on cross-border river with Pakistan?
Fragile peace: Why the Taliban-Pakistan ceasefire can’t end the conflict
item.description: The ceasefire between Pakistan and Afghanistan may not hold the antagonism in abeyance much longer

item.title: Trump and Xi in Busan: A tactical pause in US-China rivalry
item.description: While a temporary agreement was reached between the United States and China, the fundamental competitive dynamics remain

item.title: JeM’s new terror strategy post Operation Sindoor: Weaponising women for jihad
item.description: The decision of Jaish-e-Mohammed, known for religious conservatism, to start a separate female brigade shows that it is flexible in making tactical changes and adjustments when it comes to the larger objective of jihad

item.title: Pakistan on edge as India strengthens Afghan relations
item.description: The Pakistani leadership is now convincing its people that India is backing terrorist groups operating against it from Afghan soil. Islamabad’s hypocrisy is obvious: It wants from Kabul what it doesn’t do for Delhi.

item.title: Russia’s Burevestnik missile test: How Europe is sleepwalking toward a nuclear crisis
item.description: Russia’s recent test of the Burevestnik missile marks a dangerous escalation in global nuclear competition, challenging arms control norms and exposing deepening rifts between Moscow, Washington, and Europe

item.title: Two democracies, one future: Why Washington must reset its trade ties with India
item.description: As China looms larger, a strong US-India partnership isn’t optional—it is essential. Policymakers in Washington should seize this moment and make a deal that is mutually beneficial while honouring Delhi’s aspirations
